sentence.Network_en: She visualized him stomping to his car, the picture of self-righteousness.
sentence.Network_cn: 她想象着他噔噔噔地走向车子，一副自以为是的模样。

sentence.Network_en: Both sides in the dispute have been adopting a tone of moral righteousness.
sentence.Network_cn: 纠纷双方说起话来都是冠冕堂皇。

sentence.Network_en: China has always been known as a land of propriety and righteousness.
sentence.Network_cn: 中国从来以礼义之邦著称。

entry.tran: 正直的;正义的;正派的;（有时指）假正经的，道貌岸然的
entry.def: If you think that someone behaves or lives in a way that is morally good, you can say that they are righteous. People sometimes use righteous to express their disapproval when they think someone is only behaving in this way so that others will admire or support them.

example.ex: Aren't you afraid of being seen as a righteous crusader?...
example.tran: 你不怕被人看作是一个装腔作势的改革者？

example.ex: He was full of righteous indignation.

sentences.en: I watched with pride, as you grew into a weapon of righteousness.
sentences.cn: 我骄傲地看着你一天天长大，成为正义的化身。
